gameplay

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • gameplay.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Game
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Game class contains the main game loop and displays the game window.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dzmitry Murzich
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(GamePanel gamePanel,
    Score score,
    int player1Color,
    int player2Color,
    int speed,
    int mapNumber)
        Game class contains the main game loop and displays the game window.
        Parameters:
        gamePanel - GamePanel object from MainWindow, used to update various panel parameters
        score - Score object from MainWindow, used to keep track of player scores
        player1Color - Integer representing player1 color, set by user in GamePanel
        player2Color - Integer representing player2 color, set by user in GamePanel
        speed - Integer representing speed setting, set by user in GamePanel
        mapNumber - Integer representing map setting, set by user in GamePanel

        public void render()
        Updates BufferedImage that stores level snapshot and renders it to screen.
